Class POProcessing

java.lang.Object
POProcessing
All Implemented Interfaces:
IElectionProcessing
public class POProcessing extends Object implements IElectionProcessing
POProcessing class used for processing a PO election. Implements IElectionProcessing, an interface outlining election processing.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private static ArrayList<String>
    candidateParties
    an ArrayList of Strings that represents the political parties of candidates candidateParties.get(i corresponds to candidates.get(i).
    private static ArrayList<String>
    candidates
    an ArrayList of Strings that represent the names of candidates.
    private static Integer[]
    candidatesBallotCounts
    an Array of integers that represents the number of votes each candidate received candidatesBallotCounts[i] corresponds to candidates.get(i).
    private static int
    numCandidates
    an Integer that stores the number of candidates in the election.
    private static int
    totalNumBallots
    an Integer that stores the total number of ballots cast in the election.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    POProcessing(BufferedReader br)
    Calls the setCandidatesAndParties() and updateBallotCounts() methods to set up the processing of a PO election and then calls processElection() to process the election.

    void
    setCandidatesAndParties(BufferedReader br)
    Reads from the election information CSV file to determine the candidates and parties and add them to a String ArrayList candidates and String ArrayList candidateParties.
    void
    updateBallotCounts(BufferedReader br)
    Reads from the election information CSV file to distribute votes to candidates by updating the values in Integer[] candidatesBallotCounts.

      an ArrayList of Strings that represent the names of candidates.

    • candidateParties

      private static ArrayList<String> candidateParties
      an ArrayList of Strings that represents the political parties of candidates candidateParties.get(i corresponds to candidates.get(i).

    • candidatesBallotCounts

      private static Integer[] candidatesBallotCounts
      an Array of integers that represents the number of votes each candidate received candidatesBallotCounts[i] corresponds to candidates.get(i).

  • Constructor Details

    • POProcessing

      public POProcessing(BufferedReader br) throws RuntimeException
      Calls the setCandidatesAndParties() and updateBallotCounts() methods to set up the processing of a PO election and then calls processElection() to process the election.
      Parameters:
      br - a BufferedReader, buffers the input from a FileReader that is reading from the election information csv file.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - throws a RuntimeException if call to updateBallotCounts() throws a RuntimeException or if call to setCandidatesAndParties() throws a RuntimeException.

  • Method Details

    • processElection

      public String processElection()
      Does the work of actually running a PO election to determine the winner. Prints the name of the winner, and if there was a tie, prints the names of those involved in the tie and who won.
      Specified by:
      processElection in interface IElectionProcessing
      Returns:
      a String representing the name of the election winner.

    • setCandidatesAndParties

      public void setCandidatesAndParties(BufferedReader br) throws RuntimeException
      Reads from the election information CSV file to determine the candidates and parties and add them to a String ArrayList candidates and String ArrayList candidateParties.
      Parameters:
      br - a BufferedReader, buffers the input from a FileReader that is reading from the election information csv file.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - throws a RuntimeException if attempting to read from the election information CSV file throws an IOException.

    • updateBallotCounts

      public void updateBallotCounts(BufferedReader br) throws RuntimeException
      Reads from the election information CSV file to distribute votes to candidates by updating the values in Integer[] candidatesBallotCounts.
      Parameters:
      br - a BufferedReader, buffers the input from a FileReader that is reading * from the election information csv file.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - throws RuntimeException if attempting to read from the election information CSV file throws an IOException.

    • getCandidatesBallotCounts

      public Integer[] getCandidatesBallotCounts()
      Used to get the number of votes each candidate received.
      Returns:
      candidatesBallotCounts, the Integer[] representing the number of votes each candidate received.

    • getCandidates

      public String[] getCandidates()
      Used to get the names of the candidates in the election, as a String[].
      Specified by:
      getCandidates in interface IElectionProcessing
      Returns:
      a String[] containing the names of the candidates in the election.

    • getCandidatesArrayList

      public ArrayList<String> getCandidatesArrayList()
      Used to get the names of the candidates in the election, as a String ArrayList.
      Returns:
      candidates, the String ArrayList containing the names of the candidates in the election.

    • getCandidateParties

      public ArrayList<String> getCandidateParties()
      Used to get the parties involved in the election, as a String ArrayList.
      Returns:
      candidateParties, the String ArrayList containing the names of the parties in the election

    • getTotalNumBallots

      public int getTotalNumBallots()
      Used to get the number of ballots cast in the election.
      Returns:
      totalNumBallots, the Integer representing the number of ballots cast in the election.

    • getVotePercents

      public String[] getVotePercents()
      Used to calculate and display the percentage of votes each candidate received. Prints the name of the candidate, their party, and the percent of votes they received.
      Returns:
      a String[] containing each candidate, their party, and the percent of votes they received as a String.
